title: Prohibits municipalities from entering into contracts for the provision of fire services by a private entity
summary: Prohibits any municipality from entering into a contract for the provision of fire protection, suppression, prevention or training services with any entity not established by a municipality and subject to the supervision of the municipality establishing such entity; makes an exception for not-for-profit corporations.

       AN ACT to amend the labor law, the county law, the general city law, the
         general  municipal  law, the town law and the village law, in relation
         to prohibiting municipalities from contracting with any private entity
         for the  provision  of  fire  protection,  suppression  or  prevention
         services

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Legislative intent. The legislature hereby finds  that  the
    2  privatization  of  fire  services by municipalities poses a considerable
    3  threat to the lives, safety and property of individuals  throughout  the
    4  state.  Public  sector  fire  services use all their resources solely to
    5  provide service and protection to  the  public.    Private  sector  fire
    6  services  exist  to  make a profit. Recent history has demonstrated that
    7  the services, experience, and the administrative and personnel  require-
    8  ments  of  private  companies  do  not  compare with the high quality of
    9  services and assurances of public safety provided by public sector  fire
   10  departments. Given the profound role fire departments play in protecting
   11  the  lives and property of all citizens, the legislature hereby declares
   12  that no governmental body may contract with any private  entity,  organ-
   13  ization,  corporation  or company for the furnishing of fire protection,
   14  fire suppression and fire prevention services.
   15    S 2. The labor law is amended by adding a new section 220-i to read as
   16  follows:
   17    S 220-I.  CONTRACTS  FOR  FIRE  PROTECTION.  NO  CITY,  COUNTY,  TOWN,
   18  VILLAGE,  AUTHORITY  OR FIRE DISTRICT SHALL CONTRACT WITH ANY ENTITY FOR
   19  THE PROVISION OF FIRE PROTECTION,  SUPPRESSION  OR  PREVENTION  SERVICES
   20  WITHIN THE BOUNDARIES OF SUCH MUNICIPALITY, UNLESS:
   21    (A) SUCH ENTITY IS CREATED BY A CITY, COUNTY, TOWN, VILLAGE, AUTHORITY
   22  OR FIRE DISTRICT AND SUBJECT TO THE SUPERVISION OF THE GOVERNING BODY OF

   43    S  173-A. PROHIBITED CONTRACT; FIRE SERVICES. NO TOWN OR FIRE DISTRICT
   44  ESTABLISHED THEREBY SHALL CONTRACT WITH ANY ENTITY FOR THE PROVISION  OF

   49  OF THE CITY, COUNTY, TOWN, VILLAGE, AUTHORITY OR  FIRE  DISTRICT  ESTAB-
   50  LISHING SUCH ENTITY; OR
   51    2. SUCH ENTITY IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION.

   53  of the village law, as added by chapter 976 of  the  laws  of  1973,  is

   12    The  contract also may provide for the furnishing of emergency service
   13  in case of accidents, calamities or other emergencies in connection with

   18  In the event that the fire department or fire  company  furnishing  fire
   19  protection within the village pursuant to contract does not maintain and

   21  furnishing within the village of emergency ambulance service or  general

   25  ambulance subject, however, in the case of general ambulance service, to

   27  law.
   28    S  8.  This  act  shall  take  effect  immediately, and shall apply to
   29  contracts entered into on or after such effective date.
